prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. This will serve as the origin for our model. Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) and draw four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.1649, 0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1649, 0], End Point [0.1649, 0.07] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1649, 0.07], End Point [0, 0.07] - Line 4: Start Point [0, 0.07], End Point [0, 0] This forms a closed loop on the X-Y plane. Now, create another 2D sketch on the X-Z plane (face_2) and draw five lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0, 0.07], End Point [0.1649, 0.07] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1649, 0.07], End Point [0.538, 0.07] - Line 3: Start Point [0.538, 0.07], End Point [0.538, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.538, 0.75], End Point [0, 0.75] - Line 5: Start Point [0, 0.75], End Point [0, 0.07] This forms another closed loop on the X-Z plane. After drawing both sketches, scale the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0, 0, 0] - Translation Vector: [0, 0, 0] Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to a depth of 0.5413 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the desired shape and dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.5413 units</description>
